properties.name: Great Wall of China
properties.description: Built between the 3rd century BC and the 17th century AD, the Great Wall is the world's largest military structure.

properties.name: Taj Mahal
properties.description: An ivory-white marble mausoleum commissioned in 1632 by the Mughal emperor Shah Jahan.

properties.name: Machu Picchu
properties.description: Built in the 15th century, Machu Picchu is the most significant tangible legacy of the Inca civilization.

properties.name: Pyramids of Giza
properties.description: The only surviving wonder of the ancient world, built as royal tombs during the Old Kingdom period.

properties.name: Great Barrier Reef
properties.description: The world's largest coral reef ecosystem, home to diverse marine life.

properties.name: Yellowstone National Park
properties.description: The first national park in the world, known for its wildlife and unique geothermal features.

properties.name: Historic Centre of Rome
properties.description: The historic center of Rome, including the Vatican City and major monuments of antiquity.

properties.name: Serengeti National Park
properties.description: Famous for its annual migration of wildebeest and home to numerous other wildlife species.

properties.name: Angkor
properties.description: Archaeological site containing the remains of the different capitals of the Khmer Empire.

properties.name: Galapagos Islands
properties.description: Volcanic archipelago known for its unique wildlife that inspired Charles Darwin's theory of evolution.

properties.name: Acropolis of Athens
properties.description: Ancient citadel containing the remains of several ancient Greek buildings of great architectural significance.

properties.name: Petra
properties.description: Ancient city famous for its rock-cut architecture and water conduit system.

properties.name: Stonehenge
properties.description: Prehistoric monument consisting of a ring of standing stones, each around 13 feet high.

properties.name: Kilimanjaro National Park
properties.description: Home to Africa's highest peak and largest free-standing volcanic mass.

properties.name: Historic Cairo
properties.description: One of the oldest Islamic cities in the world, featuring historic mosques, madrasas, and fountains.

properties.name: Göreme National Park
properties.description: Rock formations and ancient cave dwellings in Cappadocia.

properties.name: Mont-Saint-Michel
properties.description: Gothic-style Benedictine abbey and village perched on a rocky islet in Normandy.

properties.name: Venice and its Lagoon
properties.description: A unique cultural and architectural heritage integrated with its extraordinary natural setting.

properties.name: Dubrovnik Old City
properties.description: Late-medieval walled city known as the 'Pearl of the Adriatic'.

properties.name: Rapa Nui National Park
properties.description: Home to the famous moai statues of Easter Island.

properties.name: Forbidden City
properties.description: Imperial palace complex of the Ming and Qing dynasties in Beijing.

properties.name: Sagrada Familia
properties.description: Unfinished basilica designed by Antoni Gaudí, combining Gothic and Art Nouveau forms.

properties.name: Statue of Liberty
properties.description: Iconic symbol of freedom and democracy, gifted by France to the United States.

properties.name: Palace of Versailles
properties.description: Royal château and gardens that exemplify French classical architecture.

properties.name: Everglades National Park
properties.description: Largest tropical wilderness in the United States, home to many rare and endangered species.

properties.name: Potala Palace
properties.description: Winter palace of the Dalai Lamas since the 7th century, symbol of Tibetan Buddhism.

properties.name: Angkor Wat
properties.description: The largest religious monument in the world, originally constructed as a Hindu temple.

properties.name: Kakadu National Park
properties.description: A unique archaeological and ethnological reserve that has been inhabited continuously for more than 40,000 years.

properties.name: Virunga National Park
properties.description: Africa's most biologically diverse protected area, home to endangered mountain gorillas.

properties.name: Los Glaciares National Park
properties.description: Contains the largest ice mantle outside of Antarctica, with 47 large glaciers.

properties.name: Medina of Fez
properties.description: Founded in the 9th century, it is home to the oldest university in the world.

properties.name: Ha Long Bay
properties.description: Features thousands of limestone karsts and isles in various shapes and sizes.

properties.name: Kremlin and Red Square
properties.description: Historic heart of Moscow and symbol of Russia.

properties.name: Iguazu National Park
properties.description: Home to one of the largest and most spectacular waterfalls in the world.

properties.name: Timbuktu
properties.description: Historic center of Islamic culture, featuring three great mosques and numerous holy shrines.

properties.name: Borobudur Temple Compounds
properties.description: The world's largest Buddhist temple, built in the 8th and 9th centuries.

properties.name: Ngorongoro Conservation Area
properties.description: Vast crater that is home to a diverse array of wildlife and archaeological sites.

properties.name: Persepolis
properties.description: Ceremonial capital of the Achaemenid Empire, featuring magnificent ruins.

properties.name: Banaue Rice Terraces
properties.description: Ancient terraces carved into the mountains of Ifugao.

properties.name: Sian Ka'an
properties.description: Tropical forests, mangroves, and marshes home to diverse flora and fauna.

properties.name: Wieliczka Salt Mine
properties.description: Historic salt mine featuring unique underground chambers and chapels.
